nodes.name: Fermi paradox misinterpretation in astrobiology discourse
nodes.description: The belief that the absence of detected extraterrestrial intelligence necessarily implies catastrophic filters or universal self-destruction, leading to undue pessimism about humanity's prospects.
nodes.node_rationale: Introduced in Introduction as the core discrepancy to be resolved.

nodes.name: Point estimate use in Drake equation modeling
nodes.description: Practitioners often substitute single best-guess values for each Drake factor, implicitly assuming certainty and producing narrow, misleading outcome ranges.
nodes.node_rationale: Discussed in 1.2 Knowledge claims of point estimates as the mechanism generating the paradox.

nodes.name: Orders-of-magnitude uncertainty in Drake parameters
aliases: broad scientific uncertainty over Drake factors
nodes.description: Empirical and theoretical studies show that several Drake parameters, especially fl and fi, are uncertain across tens to hundreds of orders of magnitude.
nodes.node_rationale: Sections 3 and 3.1 detail this deep scientific uncertainty.

nodes.name: Uncertainty-aware Drake equation modeling
nodes.description: Design principle that Drake-equation parameters must be represented as probability distributions and propagated mathematically to obtain credible civilization-count estimates.
nodes.node_rationale: Outlined in 3.2 Using these scientific uncertainties.

nodes.name: Monte Carlo resampling of literature parameter estimates
nodes.description: Implementation technique that randomly draws each Drake factor from historical point estimates and multiplies them to create an empirical distribution for N.
nodes.node_rationale: Detailed in Section 2 Using variation in point estimates.

nodes.name: Probabilistic parameter distributions for Drake factors
nodes.description: Assigns explicit log-uniform or log-normal priors to each Drake parameter based on domain evidence, followed by Monte Carlo propagation.
nodes.node_rationale: Implemented in Section 3.2 Using these scientific uncertainties.

nodes.name: Bayesian updating with Fermi observation
nodes.description: Applies Bayes' rule to update prior distributions over N and Drake parameters by incorporating models of detection failure (random sampling, spatial Poisson, settlement, K3).
nodes.node_rationale: Explained in Section 4 Updating on the Fermi Observation.

nodes.name: Synthetic distribution shows 30% probability of no civilization per galaxy
nodes.description: Monte Carlo resampling of literature estimates yields a distribution with 30 % mass below N = 1, demonstrating that the galaxy could plausibly be empty.
nodes.node_rationale: Figure 1 in Section 2 provides this empirical validation.

nodes.name: Scientific-uncertainty simulation shows 52% probability of no civilization per galaxy
nodes.description: Using domain-informed probability distributions, the simulation returns median N = 0.32 and 52 % chance of N<1, reinforcing the dissolution of the paradox.

nodes.name: Posterior update yields 53–99.6% probability of solitude after non-detection
nodes.description: Conditioning on various non-detection models raises the probability that humanity is alone in the Milky Way to between 53 % and 99.6 %.
nodes.node_rationale: Documented in Table 2 and Figure 3, Section 4.

nodes.name: Adopt Monte Carlo-based probabilistic Drake modeling in SETI research
aliases: implement uncertainty Monte Carlo Drake analysis
replace point estimates with stochastic sampling
nodes.description: Standardize the use of Monte-Carlo simulations with probabilistic parameter inputs for Drake-equation studies, eliminating point-estimate practices and reducing overconfidence.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Research-methodology recommendation outside of AI model development lifecycle; Section 2.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Technique demonstrated in published studies but not yet universal; Section 2 & 3.2.
nodes.node_rationale: Provides actionable mitigation for the identified risk.

nodes.name: Apply Bayesian update with Fermi observation to refine civilization probability estimates
nodes.description: Incorporate explicit likelihood models of non-detection into probabilistic Drake-equation analyses to produce posterior estimates aligned with observational constraints.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Analytical refinement step in research practice; Section 4.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Proposed and exampled in this paper; wider validation pending.
nodes.node_rationale: Completes the probabilistic framework, ensuring results respect existing observations.
